channel.title: CVE Feed for SonicWall -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for SonicWall -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-6340|2024-08-30T15:24:09.000Z -- sonicwall -- capture%20client
item.description: SonicWall Capture Client version 3.7.10,Â NetExtender client version 10.2.337 and earlier versions are installed with sfpmonitor.sys driver. The driver has been found to be vulnerable to Denial-of-Service (DoS) caused by Stack-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2024-40766|2024-08-23T14:10:24.091Z -- sonicwall -- sonicos
item.description: An improper access control vulnerability has been identified in the SonicWall SonicOS management access, potentially leading to unauthorized resource access and in specific conditions, causing the firewall to crash. This issue affects SonicWall Firewall Gen 5 and Gen 6 devices, as well as Gen 7 devices running SonicOS 7.0.1-5035 and older versions.

item.title: CVE-2024-29012|2024-08-02T01:03:51.511Z -- sonicwall -- sonicos
item.description: Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS HTTP server allows an authenticated remote attacker to cause Denial of Service (DoS) via sscanf function.

item.title: CVE-2024-29013|2024-08-02T01:03:51.681Z -- sonicwall -- sonicos
item.description: Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS SSL-VPN allows an authenticated remote attacker to cause Denial of Service (DoS) via memcpy function.

item.title: CVE-2024-29011|2024-08-02T01:03:51.499Z -- sonicwall -- gms
item.description:
Use of hard-coded password in the GMS ECM endpoint leading to authentication bypass vulnerability.
This issue affects GMS: 9.3.4 and earlier versions.

item.title: CVE-2024-29014|2024-08-02T01:03:51.738Z -- sonicwall -- netextender
item.description: Vulnerability in SonicWall SMA100 NetExtender Windows (32 and 64-bit) client 10.2.339 and earlier versions allows an attacker to arbitrary code execution when processing an EPC Client update.

item.title: CVE-2024-29010|2024-08-02T01:03:51.475Z -- sonicwall -- gms
item.description:
The XML document processed in the GMS ECM URL endpoint is vulnerable to XML external entity (XXE) injection, potentially resulting in the disclosure of sensitive information.
This issue affects GMS: 9.3.4 and earlier versions.

item.title: CVE-2024-29014|2024-07-19T03:55:38.296Z -- sonicwall -- netextender
item.description: Vulnerability in SonicWall SMA100 NetExtender Windows (32 and 64-bit) client 10.2.339 and earlier versions allows an attacker to arbitrary code execution when processing an EPC Client update.

item.title: CVE-2024-29014|2024-07-18T16:38:47.259Z -- sonicwall -- netextender
item.description: Vulnerability in SonicWall SMA100 NetExtender Windows (32 and 64-bit) client 10.2.339 and earlier versions allows an attacker to arbitrary code execution when processing an EPC Client update.

item.title: CVE-2024-29014|2024-07-18T07:37:12.258Z -- sonicwall -- netextender
item.description: Vulnerability in SonicWall NetExtender Windows (32 and 64-bit) client 10.2.339 and earlier versions allows an attacker to arbitrary code execution when processing an EPC Client update.

item.title: CVE-2024-40764|2024-07-18T07:42:37.995Z -- sonicwall -- sonicos
item.description: Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS IPSec VPN allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to cause Denial of Service (DoS).

item.title: CVE-2024-22396|2024-06-21T19:20:49.979Z -- sonicwall -- sonicos
item.description: An Integer-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS via IPSec allows a remote attacker in specific conditions to cause Denial of Service (DoS) and potentially execute arbitrary code by sending a specially crafted IKEv2 payload.

item.title: CVE-2024-29011|2024-06-04T17:57:05.885Z -- sonicwall -- gms
item.description:
Use of hard-coded password in the GMS ECM endpoint leading to authentication bypass vulnerability.
This issue affects GMS: 9.3.4 and earlier versions.

item.title: CVE-2024-29010|2024-06-04T17:56:39.022Z -- sonicwall -- gms
item.description:
The XML document processed in the GMS ECM URL endpoint is vulnerable to XML external entity (XXE) injection, potentially resulting in the disclosure of sensitive information.
This issue affects GMS: 9.3.4 and earlier versions.

item.title: CVE-2024-22398|2024-03-14T03:29:03.884Z -- sonicwall -- email%20security
item.description: An improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory (Path Traversal) vulnerability in SonicWall Email Security Appliance could allow a remote attacker with administrative privileges to conduct a directory traversal attack and delete arbitrary files from the appliance file system.

item.title: CVE-2024-22397|2024-06-04T17:52:40.010Z -- sonicwall -- sonicos
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') in the SonicOS SSLVPN portal allows a remote authenticated attacker as a firewall 'admin' user to store and execute arbitrary JavaScript code.

item.title: CVE-2024-22396|2024-03-14T03:15:55.008Z -- sonicwall -- sonicos
item.description: An Integer-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS via IPSec allows a remote attacker in specific conditions to cause Denial of Service (DoS) and potentially execute arbitrary code by sending a specially crafted IKEv2 payload.

item.title: CVE-2024-29012|2024-06-20T08:11:10.318Z -- sonicwall -- sonicos
item.description: Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS HTTP server allows an authenticated remote attacker to cause Denial of Service (DoS) via sscanf function.

item.description: Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS SSL-VPN allows an authenticated remote attacker to cause Denial of Service (DoS) via memcpy function.

item.description: Stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS HTTP server allows an authenticated remote attacker to cause Denial of Service (DoS) via sscanf function.

item.description: Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS IPSec VPN allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to cause Denial of Service (DoS).

item.description: Vulnerability in SonicWall SMA100 NetExtender Windows (32 and 64-bit) client 10.2.339 and earlier versions allows an attacker to arbitrary code execution when processing an EPC Client update.

item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') in the SonicOS SSLVPN portal allows a remote authenticated attacker as a firewall 'admin' user to store and execute arbitrary JavaScript code.

item.description: Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the SonicOS IPSec VPN allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to cause Denial of Service (DoS).

item.title: CVE-2024-40766|2024-08-23T06:19:07.229Z -- sonicwall -- sonicos
item.description: An improper access control vulnerability has been identified in the SonicWall SonicOS management access, potentially leading to unauthorized resource access and in specific conditions, causing the firewall to crash. This issue affects SonicWall Firewall Gen 5 and Gen 6 devices, as well as Gen 7 devices running SonicOS 7.0.1-5035 and older versions.
